happy.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: having feelings of pleasure, for example because something good has happened to you or you are very satisfied with your life
happy.translation[0].definitions[0].note: the happy couple (=a couple that have just got married or will soon get married)
happy.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: It’s a lovely house and we’ve been very happy here.
I’ve never felt happier in my life.
He was a happy child who rarely cried.
the happy faces of the children
I loved her and thought I could make her happy.
What a wonderful opportunity! I’m so happy for you.
She’s very happy about the baby.
John will be so happy to see you.
I’m happy that everything worked out well in the end.
We’re very happy to be taking part.
happy.translation[0].definitions[0].note: You are happy to do something or happy to be doing something
I’m very happy to be here
I’m very happy for being here
You are happy that something has happened or is true
I’m very happy that I’m here
I’m so happy about your engagement
I’m so happy for your engagement
You are happy for someone when something good has happened to them
happy.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a happy time, relationship, event etc is a good one that makes you feel happy
happy.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: This has been the happiest day of my life.
They had a very happy marriage.
I have lots of happy memories of the place.
The story has a happy ending, however.
When’s the happy event (=the birth of your child)?
happy.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: I pretended to agree with her, just to keep her happy.
On the whole, I’m happy with the way I look.
People living nearby are not happy with the decision.
Mum wasn’t happy about Tess going off travelling on her own.
I’m quite happy doing what I’m doing.
happy.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: By a happy coincidence, James was also in town that weekend.
I’m in the happy position of not having to work.
happy.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: His choice of words was not a very happy one.
